Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0747 b) Date of Occurrence: 05/10/2024
c) Installation Details: Skyhawk Fighter - AC-8149-502 at
Training Center Alpha
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Structural b) Date Component 09/10/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Wing Structure d) Main Assembly: Bay-1
e) Nomenclature: Wing Structure Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-D
g) Part No.: ST-6622-J5 h) Sl No.: SN-7085-314
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 29/12/2020 l) Date of Removal: 06/10/2024
Pg No: 104 Ln No: 11 Pg No: 38 Ln No: 7
m) Manufacturing Agency: Zenith Defense Tech n) Date, Month & Year December 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2905 Hrs / 328 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Wing spar corrosion detected. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Wing Structure component. Analysis of
operational data indicated parameter deviation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: N1 - Defect confirmed but reason not established
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 31/10/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. A.K. Sharma

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 02/11/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Operational history analyzed. No abnormal usage patterns identified. Agree with proposed corrective actions.
Date: 04/11/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 04/11/2024 Signature: Eng. T.R. Menon
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 05/11/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
